reasoning: Mature cystic teratomas (dermoid cysts) are the most common ovarian tumor in reproductive-age women, occurring in ~1-2% of women, representing ~45% of ovarian tumors. Incidence ~40-60 per 100k, prevalence ~1000 per 100k.
source: Ulbright TM. (2005). Germ cell tumors of the gonads: a selective review emphasizing problems in differential diagnosis, newly recognized entities, and long-term follow-up. Mod Pathol. 18(2):S61-S79
